intro: Eriochrysis phaenostachys, commonly known as the golden hairgrass, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its dense, golden-colored inflorescence. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its small, spike-like flowers are surrounded by bracts that give it a distinctive appearance. Eriochrysis phaenostachys plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and habitat for various invertebrates and birds.
